Posts.Content: What a way to spend a Thursday evening after calling nhs 24 I'm now sitting in the out of hours at the local hospital! My symptoms seem to be getting worse daily and this evening the pain was so intense, like being stabbed in the nipple with a hot burning needle and a small area beside the nipple became swollen with a rash. I only called them to see if I should try and push my clinic appointment (17th) forward. Do you think they will do anything tonight? Tests etc? Xx
Posts.Title: Currently waiting in out of hours :(

Posts.Content: Hi everyone! Just looking to ask a quick question! I'm currently waiting on my first urgent referral to the breast clinic after different symptoms in my left breast and the gp finding a very tender "area of concern" behind the nipple (though she said she couldn't feel a lump!) tonight I was sitting on the kitchen worktop and my husband lifted me off (my arms around his neck and legs around his waist) well when he lifted me, his chest pressed against mine and the pain in my left breast is unreal... seriously throbbing now! I've just taken some painkillers and whipped my bra off but wondering if it's something I should alert my gp to even though I have been referred or has anyone any other advice? Thanks xx
Posts.Title: Sudden pain when pressed

Posts.Content: Thank you for your reply! Can I contact the breast clinic directly about my appointment do you think or is that usually done through the gp? It's just that from what I've read on here, a fast track appointment is within 2 weeks although my gp said she hoped I'd be seen within 2-6 weeks (she did say she was putting it through as an urgent referral though) the pain is now only easing off and that happened about 6 hours ago!xx
Posts.Title: Sudden pain when pressed

Posts.Content: The waiting is definitely hard going... my dr made 2 urgent referrals over 2 weeks and my appt just through, by the time the appt comes round, it will be 5 weeks since first referral (Scotland has a 4-6 week urgent referral waiting time) good luck and will keep an eye out for your update x

Posts.Title: weird areola

Posts.Content: Hi Di.. I've not had anything diagnosed yet either but I know what you are talking about with the change in the nipple and surrounding area. Tbh mine have always had quite prominent bumps, even more so when I was pregnant with my 3 kids! The dr had noticed that on my problem breast, it's as if the areola has spread, almost bruise like with thickening of skin and prominent veins running through. Do you have any of that? Hope Thursday brings you good news and sending lots of wishes Em x
